pageContext.title: In brief: Swiggy unboxes $1b for food-delivery battle
pageContext.content:
Naspers, the South African ecommerce and media investor, has announced that it is leading a new US$1 billion funding round for the Indian food-delivery group Swiggy, in a major bet on the future of the sector in the rapidly growing Indian economy.

Source: Financial Times

Started in 2014, Swiggy is now Indiaâ€™s top meal-delivery app, covering 50,000 restaurants in 50 cities.

Tencent, which is also backed by Naspers, made its first contribution to Swiggy in this round.

seo.title: Swiggy unboxes $1b for India's food delivery battle
seo.description: Naspers led the round, with Tencent joining in.
